Show Snapshot VSS

This app will create a Microsoft Windows Shadow Copy of a volume. Users typically have no easy or readily available way to create a Shadow Copy in Windows 7. In Windows 8, users have no method at all to create a Shadow Copy. This app will make it possible for any regular user to create a Shadow Copy on demand.
Click on the "Create a Shadow Copy" to create a snapshot immediately, on-demand.
Click on the "List Shadow Copies" to bring up a list of all snapshots available on your system.
Click on "Schedule Shadow Copies" to schedule a snapshot to be created daily at 12:00pm. Of course, for the schedule to work and take a snapshot, your machine must be running at the scheduled time. Otherwise, a snapshot will not be taken.
Click on the "Show Shadow Storage" to show the configuration of storage for your shadow copies.
Click on the "Set Max Shadow Copies" to set your max shadow copies.
Click on the "Set Maximum Cache" to set your maximum cache for VSS.
Click on the "Mount All Shadow Copies" to mount all Shadow Copies to c:\vss folder.
Click on the "Enable Admin Account" to enable the Administrator user account, on-demand.
Click on the "Display Snapshot Report" on windows 7 or greater to display the Snapshot Report.

This area is dedicated to providing technical details about the app. Provide the mechanics of how the app works. Generally speaking, if you are making changes to a user's computer, it's best to detail those changes in a completely transparent manner.

Include more details than what would appear on the "Overview" tab and be free to use more technical language in the process.

This area is dedicated to having a set of frequently asked questions that a common user may ask.

Q: How do I see the difference of what is current on my drive and what is in a shadow copy?
A: Map a drive letter to a shadow copy and you can then compare both drive letters.

Q: What are Shadow Copies?
A: Shadow Copies are snapshots of a volumne at a given time.

Q: What is Microsoft's Previous Versions?
A: Previous Versions is a tool that allowed the user to restore files or folders from a shadow copy. This tool was made available in Windows Explorer.

Q: Why do I need shadow copies?
A: Windows Backup and Restore points use shadow copies.

Q: where are Shadow Copies Kept?
A: You can specify what volume you want to keep your shadow copies on if you have not created any shadow copies yet. The default is the volume where the source files are.

Q: How do I configure Shadow Storage?
A: The default size is 10% of the volume. It must be at least 300 MB.

About the SnapBack Apps Co-op

SnapBack Apps is designed to allow regular users to work with developers in the hope of building and bettering the applications we use daily. The SnapBack Apps Co-op is the platform where contributors communicate, design, and ultimately work together to accomplish this mission.

To improve the SnapBack Apps project, try the following options:

Tell others:
Show how a SnapBack App is a solution to an asked question on sites like SuperUser.com. Many sites offer written solutions that advise, if you hand-type or apply the fix. Often, the solutions published vary in quality, method, have no error handling, and require more context and understanding than most users have. By simply referring them to that specific App's page, users on that site can simply choose to and safely apply that fix with a single click, (or first install SnapBack). Read "best practices" and "example answers" to a posted problem, using links to a specific SnapBack App page.

Contribute to our Factory:
This app was created with developers working in collaboration with users like you. We want your input and valuable contributions towards this app! We'd like to hear ANYTHING, good or bad, that you have to say. (We will NEVER hide ANY feedback.) Feedback can include any improvements you wish to see in this app, suggested layout/content changes, and development enhancements. We will generally publish edited excerpts from your input.

The SnapBack Apps Factory is a platform where regular users interact with, or become App contributors and developers themselves. Most technology products initially frustrates users unnecessarily. If new versions were produced daily, users and developers were constantly communicating, products would quickly evolve to work perfectly. SnapBack Apps' mission is to modify how any existing hardware and software interacts with ordinary users. Our Factory connects users, contributors and developers in near real time to create or improve SnapBack Apps. Changes that are apparently required are quickly communicated, applied and deployed to all users within hours. Eventually, all changes that any user would ever want, are created and deployed. The SnapBack Apps Factory platform is where contributors and users of all kinds communicate, design, and ultimately work together to accomplish this mission..
